intro: Patrinia scabiosifolia f. crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved Patrinia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
